Detailed Description

An XML node.

For tag types TAG_INSTR, TAG_COMMENT, TAG_CDATA and TAG_DOCTYPE, the text is stored in node->tag, with node->text being NULL.

A node can be deactivated, in which case it will not be taken into account in functions XMLNode_print*(), XMLNode_get_children_count(), XMLNode_get_child(), XMLNode_insert_child(), ...

If text_as_nodes is zeroed during parsing, the node->text is the concatenation of all texts found under the node: <a>text<b/>other text</a> will show node->tag == "a" and node->text == "textother text". If text_as_nodes is non-zeroed, the same node will have 3 children: child [0] type is TAG_TEXT (with text "text"), child [1] type is TAG_SELF and child [2] type is TAG_TEXT (with text "other text").

N.B. that when reading a pretty-printed XML, the extra line breaks and spaces will be stored in node->text.

Field Documentation

◆ active

int active

'true' to tell that node is active and should be displayed by 'XMLDoc_print_*()'.

◆ attributes

XMLAttribute* attributes

Array of attributes.

◆ children

struct _XMLNode** children

Array of children nodes.

◆ father

struct _XMLNode* father

Pointer to father node. NULL if root.

◆ init_value

int init_value

Initialized to 'XML_INIT_DONE' to indicate that node has been initialized properly.

◆ n_attributes

int n_attributes

Number of attributes in attributes array (might not be the number of active attributes).

◆ n_children

int n_children

Number of nodes in children array (might not be the number of active children).

◆ tag

SXML_CHAR* tag

Tag name, or text for tag types TAG_INSTR, TAG_COMMENT, TAG_CDATA and TAG_DOCTYPE.

◆ tag_type

TagType tag_type

Node type.

◆ text

SXML_CHAR* text

Text inside the node, or NULL if empty.

◆ user

void* user

Pointer for user data associated to the node.
